Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Please tell me these are the only two. I haven't even stretched properly yet.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Focus on your footwork and shut your mouth!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Ugh, blood on the velvet lapels. Do you have any idea how much a good tailor costs in this economy?

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Quit your whining, pretty boy. We're deep in enemy territory. More are coming.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Right, right.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: So, what's the play? Do we slip through the shadows, or run in like maniacs?

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Let's stick to the shadows. I'd rather not ruin my boots.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Smartest thing you've said all night. Keep your head down.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Why hide? I look fantastic tonight. Let's give them a show.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: You arrogant fool. Fine, but I'm not carrying your corpse.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Shh. Up ahead. A lone sentry.

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: ...swore I heard something over here...

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: I can talk our way past him. Or you can introduce him to your axe. Your call, old man.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Watch a master at work.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: This is going to end terribly.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Do your thing, Dougal. Try not to make a mess.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Finally, we speak the same language.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Evening, my good man! Beautiful night for a patrol, wouldn't you say?

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: What in the blazes?! Intruders! I'm calling theâ€”

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Ah, wait, wait! Look at this heavy purse of gold. Awfully heavy to carry all by myself.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Take this, turn around, and buy yourself something nice.

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: Uh... right. I didn't see nothing. Just some shadows.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: A waste of good coin, but we're through.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: ...But I think I'll keep it. Dougal, strike!

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: You trickster!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Messy, but effective. The captain is just ahead.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Lead the way, my delightfully violent friend.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Ho there! We are here to ruin someone's evening!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: You've alerted the heavy hitters. Brace yourself, boy!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Hit him harder, you pampered fop! It's barely scratching him!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Whew. He was a big one. I think I chipped a nail.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: We need to keep moving. The inner sanctum is close.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Give me a minute to catch my breath. And fix my hair.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Every second we waste is a second they have to prepare. Fine.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: No rest for the wicked. Let's ride this adrenaline high!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: That's the spirit! Let's crack some skulls!

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: You've gone far enough! We have an Ogre on our side!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Oh, wonderful. More brutes who lack conversational skills.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Less talking, more swinging, Ambrose! Here they come!

Steps.Speaker: Orc
Steps.Text: Me crush tiny men into paste!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Ugh, the halitosis on this one is the real weapon.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: And that, my grumpy companion, is how it's done.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Hmph. Not bad. You actually held your own out there.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Drinks are on you tonight! Assuming we can find a tavern that hasn't burned down.
